methods.name: createApplication
methods.desc: Initialize the staking pool w/ owner and manager, but can only be created by the validator contract.

args.name: creatingContractID
args.desc: id of contract that constructed us - the validator application (single global instance)

args.name: validatorID
args.desc: id of validator we're a staking pool of

args.name: minEntryStake
args.desc: minimum amount to be in pool, but also minimum amount balance can't go below (without removing all!)

args.name: maxStakeAllowed
args.desc: maximum algo allowed in this staking pool

methods.name: gas
methods.desc: gas is a dummy no-op call that can be used to pool-up resource references and opcode cost

methods.name: initStorage
methods.desc: Called after we're created and then funded so we can create our large stakers ledger storageCaller has to get MBR amounts from ValidatorRegistry to know how much to fund us to cover the box storage costIf this is pool 1 AND the validator has specified a reward token, opt-in to that tokenso that the validator can seed the pool with future rewards of that token.

args.name: mbrPayment
args.desc: payment from caller which covers mbr increase of new staking pools' storage

methods.name: addStake
methods.desc: Adds stake to the given account.Can ONLY be called by the validator contract that created usMust receive payment from the validator contract for amount being staked.

args.name: stakedAmountPayment
args.desc: prior payment coming from validator contract to us on behalf of staker.

returns.desc: {uint64}new 'entry time' in seconds of stake add.

methods.name: removeStake
methods.desc: Removes stake on behalf of caller (removing own stake).  If any token rewards exist, those are always sent infull. Also notifies the validator contract for this pools validator of the staker / balance changes.

args.name: amountToUnstake
args.desc: The amount of stake to be removed.  Specify 0 to remove all stake.

methods.name: getStakerInfo
methods.desc: Retrieves the staked information for a given staker.

returns.desc: {StakedInfo}- The staked information for the given staker.

methods.name: payTokenReward
methods.desc: Remove a specified amount of 'community token' rewards for a staker.This can ONLY be called by our validator and only if we're pool 1 - with the token.

args.name: staker
args.desc: the staker account to send rewards to

args.name: rewardToken
args.desc: ID of reward token (to avoid re-entrancy in calling validator back to get id)

args.name: amountToSend
args.desc: amount to send the staker (there is significant trust here(!) - also why only validator can call us

methods.name: updateAlgodVer
methods.desc: Update the (honor system) algod version for the node associated to this pool.  The node management daemonshould compare its current nodes version to the version stored in global state, updating when different.The reti node daemon composes its own version string using format:{major}.{minor}.{build}{branch}[{commit hash}],ie: 3.22.0 rel/stable [6b508975]

args.name: algodVer
args.desc: string representing the algorand node daemon version (reti node daemon composes its own meta version)

methods.name: epochBalanceUpdate
methods.desc: Updates the balance of stakers in the pool based on the received 'rewards' (current balance vs known staked balance)Stakers outstanding balance is adjusted based on their % of stake and time in the current epoch - so that balancecompounds over time and staker can remove that amount at will.The validator is paid their percentage each epoch payout.Note: ANYONE can call this.
